entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,114Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.

We’re having dinner together on Sunday.” “Not… not with the kids.” Clark takes another breath. “I meant just- just you and me.” He smiles nervously. “On a date.” ---------------------------Clark asks Bruce out. entry.title: When I Am Young and Beautiful
entry.summary:
Author: wordswillwrite

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 54,777Chapters: 15/18Kudos: 46

Summary: “I can't be both your protector and your executioner.” Clara couldn't speak. The tears spilled over, hot and bitter. Bruce reached out, his gloved hand wiping them away with a gentleness that felt like a knife. He had spent years planning how to stop her, building lead-lined vaults she couldn't see, hiding caches of Kryptonite across the globe—all while she had spent her life trying to love the man behind the cowl. Or) Bruce Wayne, the most dramatic man she knows, dies quietly one afternoon in his Manor. Clara is left to pick up the pieces. To the world, she is Superwoman, an ageless symbol of hope. To Metropolis, she is Clara Kent, an editor hiding behind layers of synth-skin makeup to show the age she will never experience. But at Bruce Wayne’s funeral, the mask is slipping. Left behind in the wake of his ten-year silence is a grieving family, a dying Lex Luthor with a devastating secret, and one final parting gift from a man who was both loving and ruthless.

entry.title: Take a chance on me
entry.summary:
Author: Panickymouse29

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,919Chapters: 46/?Kudos: 39

Summary: Aileen Allen was recruited into the Avatar Program at twenty-two after drawing RDA attention for her effectiveness in close-quarters security operations where escalation repeatedly failed. She wasn’t chosen for aggression, but for control—she ended threats quickly and quietly in environments where firearms were a liability. The RDA classified her as difficult: independent, resistant to rigid command, and openly critical of excessive force. Those traits would normally have ended her candidacy. Dr. Grace Augustine intervened, citing Aileen’s adaptability and restraint as exactly what the program lacked. On Pandora, Aileen immediately modified her uniform for mobility and heat, ignoring protocol in favour of survival. She demonstrated an unusual tendency to de-escalate Na’vi encounters rather than provoke them, earning Grace’s quiet approval—and RDA’s suspicion. By the time Jake Sully arrived, Aileen was already operating on the fringe of RDA control: respected by the scientists, tolerated by command, and trusted by Grace to act when others would make things worse.Pandora didn’t recruit Aileen Allen. Grace Augustine did.

entry.title: Save a Horse, Ride a Cowboy
entry.summary:
Author: frogonadollar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,076Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 163

Summary: Clark wants to take Bruce home for the holidays to meet his parents. They visit a bar Clark used to frequent in college where Bruce learns something new about the boyscout. Mechanical bull riding and a flirtatious bartender do not make for a good mix. Bruce didn't think he was the jealous type... until he is. - Bruce smirks, “I don’t know what you and that country boy got up to in here…” He walks his fingers up to grip his chin harshly. “But I can promise I’ll treat you so much better you’ll forget every bit of it.” Eidetic memory be damned. There are stars in Clark’s eyes when he swallows, submission in the soft and dazed nod he responds with. “Good boy,” and Clark preens at the praise. “You’re going to take what I give you and be grateful for it.” Bruce’s voice is heavy with desire. He maintains eye contact as he slides down that impossibly muscular body to situate between Clark’s thighs.
